item.name: serve up static assets (favicon.ico as example)
register a user or admin account

request.description:
1. Content-Type: 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' or 'application/json'
2. when req.body.admin is true, meaning registering an 'admin' account.  valid jwt must present in the x-access-token header
3. upon success, a 24 hours token will be issued with the following properties in the payload:
	* name
	* email
	* admin

response.name: register a user account

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

item.name: get total record counts on models or specified composite models
get a list of offices with details

request.description:
url query options:
1. per_page: integer
2. page: integer
3. details

item.name: request for series data with optional details
request for series by 'id' with optional details
request for product data with optional details and pagination
request for product by 'id' with optional details
insert new product and optional photos and tags with optional details
assign a product to a series
set carousel's primary status to true and all the others to false
assign a photo to a series
assign a photo to a product
assign a product to a series

request.description:
this route doesn't work properly at this time:
1. in order to use templates, an 'index.html' cannot exist in the static asset directory
2. if templates isn't used, another method must be devised on how to pass frontend/backend shared constants
3. if only static assets are to be served, maybe consider to serve directly from nginx

needs to settle how the frontend will generate
1. index.html,
2. app.js(app.min.js),
3. app.css(app.min.css),
4. and the other css libs to be included(whether to use cdn or copy from local, bulma/font-awesome)

item.name: get one series record with child products and photos

request.description:
1. request
	* header: n/a
	* body: n/a
2. response:
	* header: application/json
	* response: see example
		1. a list of product is under 'products' array property
		2. under each product, a list of photo details (without actual photo data) is listed under 'photos' array properties
3. notes:
	* primary photos is always listed as photos[0]
	* products are sorted by 'code' property

response.name: example

request.description:
1. request header:
	* Content-Type:
		* application/x-www-form-urlencoded
		* application/json
	* x-access-token: jwt token string (admin privilege required)
2. request body:
	* name: string
	* parentSeriesId: uuid string 
3. response:
	* header - Content-Type: application/json
	* body: see postman example
4. notes:
	* series name is not uniqu, so a tree node may have multiple duplicating series of the same name
	* new series is placed at the end of ordering

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:
1. request header:
	* Content-Type: application/json
	* x-access-token: jwt token string (admin privilege required)
2. request body: none
3. response:
	* header - Content-Type: application/json
	* body: see postman example (data = number of records deleted)
4. notes:
	* only prevent against childSeries and associated products
	* photo associates are either
		1. deleted: the photo is not associated with anything else
		2. seriesId set to 'NULL': if the photo is associated with other products

request.description:
1. request headers:
	* x-access-token: jwt string
2. request url query:
	* name - patch series name
	* active - patch active status (true/false)
	* order - patch order field value within a childSeries tree (min: 0, max: sibling count - 1, will be limited to this range automatically without error)
	* parentSeriesId - move a series under another series node (provide no value to url query to move series to root, e.g. "?parentSeriesId=")
3. response header: application/json
4. response body: see examples (returns the updated series record without additional data)
5. notes:
	* move a series under another always puts at the end of the existing childSeries
	* menuLevel value cannot be updated directly
	* only **ONE** query will be processed at a time in the above listed sequence

response.name: if no url query is set

request.description:
1. Content-Type:
	* application/x-www-form-urlencoded
	* application/json
2. required fields
	* email
	* password
	* botPrevention
3. a token valid for 24 hours will be issued regardless of the account's admin field status, payload:
	* id
	* name
	* email
	* admin
4. notes: request by account with NULL password field will fail
